    A small helper for Reflection.

    I-Al-Istannen, : https://github.com/I-Al-Istannen

        public static void addInterfaceToUpdate(ChangeListener interfaceToAdd)

      • getAllFieldsInClassHierachy

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Field> getAllFieldsInClassHierachy(java.lang.Class<?> start,
                                                                                  java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.reflect.Field> filter)
        Returns all fields from the class and all superclasses.
        Parameters:
        start - The start Class
        filter - A filter for the fields, in order to only return some results.
        Returns:
        All fields matching the Predicate from the whole class hierarchy.

      • getFieldValue

        public static <T> T getFieldValue(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                                  java.lang.Object handle)
        Returns the value of a field.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the return value you expect
        Parameters:
        field - The Field to get the value from.
        handle - The handle object to use (according to Field.get(Object))
        Returns:
        The value of the field.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - if the type is not what you stored it as
        ReflectionHelper.ReflectionHelperException - if any ReflectiveOperationException occurs.

      • setFieldValue

        public static void setFieldValue(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                                 java.lang.Object object,
                                 java.lang.Object newValue)
        Sets the newValue of a field. This function calls the objects that implemented the corresponding listeners. The Listeners get called the following way: 1. ObjectChangeListener 2. ChangeListener This means, that after a newValue has been changed using reflection, the update function of the object gets called first. This is so that one can make sure the object runs its necessary functions before the GUI starts updating itself.
        Parameters:
        field - The Field to set the newValue for.
        object - The object object to use (according to Field.set(Object, Object))
        newValue - The newValue to set it to
        Throws:
        ReflectionHelper.ReflectionHelperException - if any ReflectiveOperationException occurs.

      • notifyListeners

        public static void notifyListeners(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                                   java.lang.Object oldValue,
                                   java.lang.Object newValue,
                                   java.lang.Object object)
        This function is called when the value of a variable changes. Use this to launch updates or changes in other parts of the application. First thing it does is notify all the interfaces. Due to there being a risk of an unhandled exception with the Reflective invokation of the update method, they are done last so that at least the interfaces can receive an update.
        Parameters:
        oldValue - The previous value of the field
        newValue - The new value for the field
        object - the object that had its value changed
        field - is the field that was changed
